Job Title: Modern Workplace Engineer - Intune

Location: Tampa, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count? 

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.

Job Summary

 As a Modern Workplace Engineer, you will be responsible for deploying and managing solutions for our clients using Microsoft technologies. You will also troubleshoot and resolve issues, provide technical support, and collaborate with other engineering, architecture, and operations teams on best practices. You will join our team of other Engineering experts in Microsoft solutions and will work on various projects involving Intune, Azure, AVD/W365, M365, Outlook, and automation tools. You will also help our clients migrate to Intune-managed endpoints and services, optimize their performance, and secure their data. In this role, you will use your skills and experience in Intune, Azure, AVD/W365, M365, Outlook, and automation to deliver high-quality services to our customers. You will implement and maintain infrastructures using Microsoft technologies and will provide guidance and support to other engineers and stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

Support the day-to-day engineering activities of all Intune policies & controls, endpoint configurations, peripherals, and connectors as they relate to the Microsoft Azure/Intune Product suite.Mentor and guide level 2 staff and provide SME advice on all network operations center problem calls.Create and maintain documentation for responsible technologies including diagrams, SOPs, TSS, end user guides, & technology runbooks just to name a few.Ensuring compliance across all Intune-managed devices and creating appropriate exception reporting to quickly identify areas of non-compliance.Create and maintain technology related documents and review recommended best practices to aid in continuous improvement and decrease Mean Time to Repair (MTTR).Monitor the health & performance of the client applications and infrastructure and make suggestions for improving efficiency.Contribute to current and future product development.Lead and execute technology and platform implementations and migrations.Provide escalated technical support and training for Tier I and Tier II technical personnel.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing service delivery, and automating manual processes.Provide timely, effective, clear, and concise communications.Research and recommend innovative, and where possible, automated approaches to reduce overhead associated with manual processes.

Skills & Experiences:

4-6 years’ Engineering-level experience with Microsoft Intune, Azure, and Windows based applications such as M365, Teams, etc.Proficient in Microsoft Intune software administration, Compliance, Device Configuration Profiles, App Protection Policies, App configurations, Conditional Access, PowerShell, PowerShell Modules, Custom roles, Storage containers, Azure Active Directory, Automation accounts.Lead or contribute to technology discussions, speak confidently and concisely to items related to your technology, and help lead other technology teams to a common solutionAbility to work well in a dynamic team environment while at the same time able to work independently to complete deliverables often with slim deadlines.Ability to work well under pressure and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Working knowledge of Teams, Teams Calling, SharePoint, & Copilot preferred but not required.Bachelor’s degree in information technology or equivalent experience preferred.4-6 years’ experience with Intune, Azure, AVD/W365, M365, Outlook, & automation desirable.

The typical base pay range for this role is between $145K - $182K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. For more information on our Total Rewards package, please click the link below.

MUFG Benefits Summary

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender expression, gender identity, sex, age, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran and military status, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status of an individual or that individual’s associates or relatives that is protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
